thread.title: Cubs downed by Mets in NLCS opener
thread.title_full: Cubs downed by Mets in NLCS opener

title: Cubs downed by Mets in NLCS opener
text:
Cubs downed by Mets in NLCS opener 
By Dean Pantazi - 21 Alive Cubs downed by Mets in NLCS opener October 17, 2015 Updated Oct 17, 2015 at 11:55 PM EDT 
NEW YORK (21 Alive) - Daniel Murphy's first inning homer off John Lester got the New York Mets rolling in their 4-2 win over the Chicago Cubs Saturday night in Game 1 of the National League Championship Series. 
The Cubs did pull even in the fifth on an RBI double by Starlin Castro, but the Mets went ahead to stay in their half of the inning on a run scoring base hit by Curtis Granderson. 
Kyle Schwarber homered for the other Chicago run while Travis d'Arnaud also homered for New York.
